caption: This is a beautiful park and what’s even better is the views. My favorite part was the rose ring parakeet. Had a wonderful time looking at the views of the Eiffel Tower and watching the beautiful birds in the park. Highly recommend.
Amazing place to view the Eiffel Tower from. If you want a view of the tower especially when it sparkles then you need to come to this spot. Lots of people so choose a good time late night.

I mean, it’s Paris. The Eiffel tower is just breathtaking in person at night time. Be ready to be swarmed by many vendors and overwhelming amounts of people everywhere. Watch out for pick pocketers. Def recommend to visit at night time. It’s a different experience than during the daytime

The Trocadéro Gardens are a stunning gem in Paris, offering one of the most breathtaking views of the Eiffel Tower. Perfectly located across the Seine River from the iconic landmark, these gardens are an absolute must-visit for anyone exploring the city.  The gardens themselves are beautifully maintained, with expansive lawns, vibrant flower beds, and a serene ambiance that invites you to relax and take in the surroundings. The central feature, the Warsaw Fountain, is mesmerizing, especially when its cascading jets of water are in full display. It’s a favorite spot for photographers, as the combination of the fountain and the Eiffel Tower in the background creates an unforgettable frame.  The Trocadéro Gardens are not only picturesque but also incredibly versatile. Families can enjoy a leisurely stroll, couples can revel in the romantic atmosphere, and visitors of all ages can appreciate the wide-open spaces for relaxing or picnicking. The playgrounds and small cafes nearby make it family-friendly, while the street performers and artists add a lively touch to the area.  Visiting at sunset or in the evening is particularly magical. As the Eiffel Tower begins to sparkle and the lights of the city come alive, the view from Trocadéro becomes truly unforgettable. It’s one of the best places to soak in Paris’s charm and take iconic photos.  The location is also convenient, with easy access to public transportation and close proximity to other attractions, such as the Palais de Chaillot. The surrounding terraces and steps provide additional vantage points for panoramic views of Paris.  Overall, the Trocadéro Gardens offer a perfect blend of natural beauty, architectural elegance, and unparalleled views of the Eiffel Tower. Whether you’re visiting for a peaceful escape, a romantic moment, or simply to marvel at the city’s beauty, this spot never disappoints. A well-deserved 5-star experience that captures the essence of Paris!

It was a great experience after 15 years that I’ve been to venue for the first time. The gardens are as stunning as I remember, the perfectly manicured lawns and fountains setting the stage for my long-awaited reunion. But this time, it wasn’t just the breathtaking view of the Eiffel Tower that captivated me; it was the feeling of coming back to a Paris that I had never truly left in my heart.
A great place to take closeup pictures of the magnificent Eiffel Tower. It’s just too crowded and too many street vendors to block the view. I did not encounter any pickpockets or scammers.
Loved to get lost in the buildings on the side of the garden you get some stunning view points. Also the atmosphere is good all people happy and enjoying while waiting the eiffel tower to light on!

The view of the Eiffel Tower from Trocadéro Gardens is simply breathtaking! The tower stands majestically, beautifully illuminated, especially during sunset. The lush gardens in the foreground provide a perfect contrast, with lovely pathways and vibrant flowers. It's a fantastic spot for photos and a peaceful place to relax. A must-visit for anyone in Paris!

Best view of Paris on the Eiffel Tower. During the day, there's often people performing there, it's quite nice. During the night, you need to come here every hours to see the sparkling Eiffel Tower.  However, the gardens below are a lil bit dirty, I would not be surprised to find rats or weird people by night.

Trocadéro Gardens in Paris is a picturesque and iconic spot, offering breathtaking views of the Eiffel Tower. With its elegant fountains, expansive lawns, and classic architecture, it’s an ideal place for a leisurely stroll or a relaxing picnic. The gardens are well-maintained, with plenty of benches and shady areas to sit and take in the beautiful surroundings. The combination of greenery and water features, particularly the stunning **Fountains of Warsaw**, adds to the serene ambiance. It's especially magical at sunset or in the evening when the Eiffel Tower lights up, making it a favorite among photographers and tourists alike.

A lot of crowds but worth it! Best time is sunset time and around nightime every hour the lights of the eiffel tower flash for 5 minutes. In the winter period it starts at 20h00 and the last one is at 23h00 I think. If you catch the metro 6 from Trocadero towards Nation, you have nice views of the Eiffel tower when crossing the bridge so I recommend taking a video.
It's quite possibly the best viewpoint for Eiffel tower. The area does have a bunch of vendors tho so beware with your personal belongings
It's fantastic. I visited early morning, but it is better than over the Olympics. Fantastic view as always
This place offers an amazing view of the Eiffel tower. A very lively place to visit while exploring the exquisite monument.

Took my dogs here from the UK and was lovely. People stopped to take photos and chat and everyone was really nice. Always bits going on here too, making it a nice atmosphere.  Downside is the amount of cons/hussles going on, which can be avoided with more police presence.

This place is just breathtaking. The atmosphere is outta this world where romance is in there. I could see couples taking photos, bridal photoshoots and just happy people all around. The view of the tower was the best.

If you're wanting to watch the Eiffel Tower light show, this is the best spot in Paris to do so. Make sure you arrive at least 30 minutes before it starts so you can get a space as the area gets busy leading up to the display.

If you happen to visit Paris, despite all the construction work for the Olympic Games, this garden is a great way to walk and visit city monuments. Placed between the Trocadéro square and the Eiffel Tower, the Seine is a great cooling element after a little walk.  It’s always great to enjoy a bit a nature in a city environment.  What makes this place special are these little padlocks with sentimental values. It’s a real pleasure to see that romance is still alive in the city of love.
Well worth walking up to the top and getting the best view of the Eiffel Tower from this area !
Nice place for great pictures of the Eiffel Tower! Just keep in mind that it gets really crowded,  so try to arrive there early!
A good as spot to capture yourself with the glory of the Eiffel tower 🗼 …
Great spot for Eiffel background pictures but gets crowded quickly except very early in the morning.

For a truly breathtaking panorama of the Eiffel Tower, ascend to the top of the Arc de Triomphe. From this vantage point, the tower stands majestically against the Parisian skyline, its intricate details visible even from afar. The sweeping vista also encompasses other iconic landmarks, making it a feast for the eyes.
One of the best place to take pics with Eiffel towers. There are professional photographers who will charge around €10 for 3 to 4 pics. Worth paying
Nice place to take photo. Many tourists. Felt safe too at night

Great spot for a pic!  Then down to the right follow steps down towards the tower.  Watch for pick pockets!! They are families playing the 3 cup game. They work together. 4 sets down the path to Eiffel. If cop comes they all quit playing and sit down.
Lovely evening and beautiful sight . Busy as expected and as always look out for pick pocket groups. Recommend to all

It was a walk from Eiffel tower into the park Although there was lot of barricading for the preparation for the Olympics  Usually this is a gorgeous area with ideal spots for photos of the Tour Eiffel as recommended by friends . However, the preparation for the Olympics has begun so most of its charm has been covered up. Once the Olympics are over in a few months , then it should return to its regular state. The place itself is very crowded in the post 9 pm to catch the glimpse of the 🗼 🗼 🗼 with glitter . Overall you can be at the garden as you walk up the park or at the main open space area .
The views are the beat at Trocadero, and it's easy to get to by subway. Perfect pic location but always packed with tourists. There are better pic locations nearby.
Best place I've seen in my life. Best view of eiffel tower especially during night time. Wowwwww..
When clearwed of all the crowd control from the Oylmpics, this area has reeally good views across the river to the Eiffel Tower.
Great views of the Eiffel Tower. Currently undergoing building work so there are temporary fences around.
Perfect place to view the very majestic and beautiful Eiffel Tower
Great spot to watch the light show on the Eiffel Tower. Amazing view. The peddlers around there weren’t pushy at all, actually enjoyed having them there their beer prices were pretty reasonable.
Beautiful view of the Eiffel tower, I recommend checking the weather for a clear day or going in the morning to get a better view with fewer people

Great place to view the tower night and day! Especially in night when it's sparkling it's so beautiful. The place is very crowded, just have this in mind, you can go picnic if you want. but the view is worth it. I definitely recommend to visit it 2 times
Amazing view  from other side of eiffel Tower . But still closing some area  due  to olympic

Due to the Olympics, a few areas were blocked off, but there are still several places to get good photos of the Eiffel Tower. I didn’t manage to go up the tower because tickets were sold out even a month in advance, but it looked very crowded up there.
